data.title: Godot 3.0 texture import is extremely slow
data.body:
_bugsquadedit:_ it's slow due to etc2comp, it needs to be disabled if you are not doing mobile, There probably should be an option for this when you create the project, though if we make it happen on background it might not be too bad.

---------

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot v. 3.0 alpha build 1

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
it takes a very long time to import textures into Godot. This is especially true for large textures, 2k and up.
When we imported 5 textures in 4k resolution into our project, it took around 4-5 minutes to import them. Compared to Unity, Unreal engine and other 3d programs this is a very long time.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Import a few textures that's at least 2048x2048 in size.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Project manager reset occasionally

mint 17.2 / 2.14 beta 

**Issue description:**

The project manager will reset suddenly, when I start godot and the project list will become empty, all the previous projects are not shown. The language may also reset. I experience this issue in previous version as well.

**Steps to reproduce:**
start godot and it may happen suddenly.

data.title: iOS lighting issues
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Tested on iOS 11 (beta4), Godot master build 2nd of August 

**Issue description:**
Lighting goes all weird, probably something to do with ambient lighting or something. Problem goes away when you use an HDR for the background so using say the material tester scene rendering is spot on.

See for instance my primitive test scene:
![img_6438](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1945449/28902274-410bc5f0-7841-11e7-9b37-eef7a1b06e37.jpg)

It almost looks like the normal vector is used for colors, note how upward facing surfaces are greenish while vertical faces are red/blue?

It should look something like this:
![primitives in godot 3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1945449/28902328-8bb0ca7e-7841-11e7-82bd-75307a50ad1e.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Easiest and best way to reproduce:
- create a new scene
- add a cube, set the material to a simple white material
- add a camera and a directional light, you'll see in the godot editor it all renders just fine there
- export to iOS and run, you'll see the cube is all purple and red

fixes #9636 

The problem was #8694 fixed the arrow in the master which works, but then someone cherry picked the commit to 2.1 which doesn't work. So I changed the code back to the working code in 2.1.

data.title: Failed to build on Windows
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 Pro x64
Godot 3.0
**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
trying to build godot source on windows with scons -j10 platform=windows.
get the error:
c:\z_development\godot_source\drivers\gles3\rasterizer_storage_gles3.h(39): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'shaders/canvas.glsl.gen.h': No such file or directory
scons: *** [platform\windows\os_windows.windows.tools.32.obj] Error 2
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2017\Community\VC\Tools\MSVC\14.10.25017\include\exception(366): warning C4577: 'noexcept' used with no exception handling mode specified; termination on exception is not guaranteed. Specify /EHsc
scons: building terminated because of errors.

**Steps to reproduce:**
cloned godot source,
install py2.7 32bit, pywin32 32bit, scons
install vs2017 with desktop c++ component
add python folder to PATH
run developer command prompt
run  command scons -j10 platform=windows

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: [Suggestion] "Export Selected Node to GDScript" Feature!
data.body:
Cannot believe I just finally thought of this!

Basically, the option ("Export Node to GDScript") could be listed in the context menu when right clicking a node:
![](https://i.gyazo.com/e94c39167865dd6f07de8847f6275b04.png)

This would generate the GDScript, then show it in a selectable text Popup menu. 

![untitled-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10387670/28899529-780d2dce-77a0-11e7-949b-9b863fd2b5be.png)

For example, the c_player -> label is a marker for the minimap. I have to generate that node dynamically when players join the world anyway. So instead of just copying all those inspector field values (texture region for sprite, etc) manually, the developer can just click on "Export Node to GDScript", then use the code his `AddPlayerToMiniMap` method. 

You might be wondering... well just export it as a scene and instance it. You're not wrong... however I still think this would be something really unique & useful! :D :D

data.title: Tabs.set_current_tab does not fire tab_changed signal
data.body:
```
extends Tabs

func changed( tab ):
	print("test")

func _ready():
	connect("tab_changed",self,"changed")
	
	add_tab("Tab1",null)
	add_tab("Tab2",null)
	set_current_tab(1)
	set_current_tab(0)
```
It only fires on tab changes with mouse.
Clicking on the same tab always sends a "tab_changed" Signal

data.title: Revert "Tweak command-line arguments to make them more UNIX-like"
data.body: Reverts godotengine/godot#10014

data.title: Collision shape gizmos do not update after changing node transform
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Tested 3.0 alpha snapshot, as well as latest build.

PC:
*  GPU: Nvidia GTX 660
*  CPU: Intel i5 3570k at 4.2GHz
*  RAM: 12GB DDR3
*  OS: Win 8.1 Embedded x64

Laptop:
*  GPU: Intel HD4000
*  CPU: Intel i5 3250M
*  RAM: 8GB DDR3
*  OS: Fedora 25

I have the issue on both my configs.

**Issue description:**
While moving collision shapes around I have noticed, that the gizmo does not update its transform accordingly. I have observed the issue with every type of shape resource, and it also manifests if you change the transform of any one of parent nodes.

In order to fix the issue, I have to select some other node, and then select the collision shape node again.
I have not noticed any issues with other gizmos.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create Collision Shape node and assign it a new shape
1. Try to move/rotate/scale said node, or its parent node
1. Observe the issue

**Example:**

![test](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26769454/28886574-46a1fd72-77ba-11e7-8f9c-c005a3498fec.gif)

Please note, that the perceived movement of the gizmo is caused by moving cursor over shape handles, which causes the gizmo to update its transform.

data.title: ScriptEditor: ctrl+click can open scenes & resources.
data.body: Closes #9654

data.title: Fix double finalisation of audio drivers
data.body:
Fixes #10034

After I've added the audio_server->finish call the audio drivers were being finalised twice on X11 and Windows, so with this commit the audio drivers are only finalised by AudioServer::finish (I think this is correct but @reduz might want to check this).

I've also improved the RtAudio driver to create the mutex at the top of init() to prevent multiple mutex creation, and also improved the finish() function to lock the mutex before using dac functions (to prevent any race condition with the callback func).

data.title: [GDNative/NativeScript] fix -rdynamic and removed _init call
data.body:
The _init call was buggy anyway and in the end shouldn't be a
thing that's called via ClassDB, it should be something that's
language specific, so we leave this out for the bindings.

In the commit 66a7763 the SCsub file for GDNative was changed to
use a cloned environment, that bricked -rdynamic which needs to be
passed down to the linker, which didn't happen with the new env.

data.title: Added get_used_cells_by_id method 3.0
data.body: same as #9975 but for 3.0

data.title: Add handling of touch events in _gui_input_event
data.body:
Right now `_gui_input_event` function of `Viewport` is processing mouse events, but ignores touch events (`InputEventScreenTouch` and `InputEventScreenDrag`). As effect of that, there are two problems:

1. `_gui_input(event)` doesn't receive touch events, which makes difficult to create controls that can use multi-touch. Sure, you can use `_input(event)` as workaround, but it leaves some problems like "input fighting" between overlapping controls.

2. `mouse_filter` property of controls doesn't work for touch events. As a result, events "fall through" all controls and go into `_unhandled_input(event)`. And this may be bad if you're trying to handle touch events inside the world (like, for pinch-zoom).

I'm not sure if this was made this way intentionally, but to me it makes more sense if both mouse events and touch events are handled the same way.

So, I propose to add processing of `InputEventScreenTouch` and `InputEventScreenDrag` inside `_gui_input_event` similarly to mouse events.

Well, actually, I already implemented this feature in my local fork of repository, but I'm unsure if I should create PR or leave it like that, since it changes behavior of input system.

PS. I use master branch of engine, so it's all about upcoming Godot 3.0

data.title: Deleting an asset/resource should remove imports & related files as well
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot alpha1 v3.0

So when you delete something like an `obj`, `png`, `dae`, whatever which have been imported it's reasonable to remove all other related files from `.import` and the `*.import`, `*.flags` etc. files. In case of `obj` with material stored in `*.mtl` (I think) should also be removed... I guess. And same for other files that might have interconnections?!

Goes in #8000? :)

data.title: Play project window closes without warning due to missing dependency.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Mint (Ubuntu) x64
For Godot v3.0 build 18e23ad


**Issue description:**
Upon playing the project, if there is a missing dependency (renamed material), the project play window will simply start up then exit.  **No errors are shown in the output nor the debugger.**

I found that this error is caused by a broken dependency.


**Steps to reproduce:**
1.) Import your model
2.) Create and save your spacial material.
3.) Rename that spacial material.
4.) Play the project, then no luck :(
**NOTE: This bug will not appear when you close and reopen your project.**

*Perhaps this bug can be fixed from tackling issue https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/9685?*


**Link to minimal example project:**
[10035.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1192721/10035.tar.gz)

data.title: OGV video files no longer supported on Godot 3.0
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
- Device: MacBook Pro (Retina, 15-inch, Mid 2014)
- OS: macOS Sierra 10.12.5 (16F73)
- Godot version: v3.0 alpha

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Exported OGV Video file but it doesn't recognize the format anymore.

```python
var stream = preload("res://video.ogv")
```
throws an error: `Parser Error: Can't preload resource at path: res://video.ogv`

Please help!

I've used the version 2.1.4.beta.2017.06.25 and works well there.

![ogv-no-longer-supported-godot3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9617583/28852397-c390a956-76f6-11e7-9c71-e65d00f1dcbb.jpg)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Add OGV video file to the `res://` directory
2. Preload it from a script as described above.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
- Video Example for Testing: [video.ogv.zip (2.5mb)](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1192271/video.ogv.zip)

data.body:

Trying to access details of resources brings you back to the node display on the resource.
